# Import String
    

# How does it work?
There are 4 actions in this import:
1. **Get the smack message** - watches chat for messages containing _only_ the word "smack" and checks if they match the randomised word.
2. **Smack fail** - Sends a message to chat telling the user they guessed wrong.
3. **Smack successful** - Sends a message to chat telling the user they guessed correctly. Disables the entire action group, then enables the **Start the smack game** action so the game can be started again.
4. **Start the smack game** - Randomises the capitalisation of the word _smack_ (e.g. SmACk) and uses it as the target word for the session. Enables the rest of the actions in the group then disables itself so the game session is not accidentally modified halfway.

## Preparation in OBS
Create a browser source and turn on the **local file** option. Download mosquito.png (it's actually an APNG!) and point the browser source to it. Set both the width and height to 200.
Paste this into the custom CSS section:

    body { background: transparent !important; margin: 0px auto; overflow: hidden; }
    img { background: none !important; }

You can use this trick to load other APNG files into OBS. It's better than GIF because the colour depth is not limited to 256 bits.

![Mosquito](https://github.com/Faffery/streamerbotstuff/blob/main/smackgame/mosquito.png)


## What you need to change in Streamer.bot:
**Start the smack game** action:
- Set up your own channel point reward in Streamer.bot and set it as the trigger.
- Change **Reward Set Enabled State** to your channel point reward.
- Change **OBS Source Visibility State** to the browser source you made earlier.

**Get the smack message** action:
- Download smack.mp3 or make your own smacking sound file. Change **Play sound** to point to your smack sound file.

**Smack successful** action:
- Change **Reward Set Enabled State** to your channel point reward.
- Change **OBS Source Visibility State** to the browser source you made earlier.
